intro: Vittadinia triloba var. lanuginosa, commonly known as the silky vittadinia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
